author: roberto.bayardo
content: <@881905303011086387> Thinking about a world in which we decide to introduce yet another extension to Transaction, this would likely involve adding some new optional field to your Transaction structure.  Even if the new field is left nil, this would cause the 4844 hash computation to change since the optional field would introduce a new leaf of merkelize(List[T, 1]).  Perhaps you can define TX_HASH_VERSION_EIP4844 to specifically SSZ.encode "4844_view(tx)" instead of "tx" (that is just SSZ-encode the Transaction as if all fields post-4844 don't exist)?

author: etan_status
content: And yes, it is exactly the spirit. The new normalized `SignedTransaction` / `Transaction` are solely used for the SSZ merkle tree. They are not intended to hit the EL devp2p network, or interfere with any coupling vs uncoupling, or complex logic based on blob / non-blob types.

author: etan_status
content: Also removed the "fixed container capacity" discussion from the EIP. It is not necessary to bundle it, especially while the execution block hash is not a hash_tree_root. Once the SSZ transition is fully complete (including block hash), we can start ossifying `GeneralizedIndex` for certain structures
